Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 12:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our contractors need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in the Moses Spring Wood area.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 2nd of February 2026 in the LU6 postcode area. Our contractors have advised us that the 15 affected properties will be restored early at approximately 15:30 as the works have progressed well. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works to replace and upgrade 3 poles along Eaton Bray Road will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-106461-C. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, we may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Our Contractors will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 7 poles that need upgrading and the need for a new pole to be installed. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
We have identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs upgrading from a single phase to three phase. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future whilst ensuring our network can cope with the amount of electricity in the area. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. Whilst carrying out this work our contractors will also be replacing 4 electricity poles and 12 cables.
 During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. Completing this work will improve the reliability of your network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned outage as we appreciate your area has been impacted by unplanned power cuts. This work is taking place on Billinghurst Road. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow our work to be carried out safely.

We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Flowers Bottom Lane.

This work is taking place near Long Road East.

This work is taking place near Hartfield Road and Spode Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:45 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers connected a generator to our network in the Horsham Lane area. We believe all power should now be restored and back to normal running.

If your power isn't back on or you are still experiencing any issues, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have advised that an existing generator currently on the network needs to be adjusted as well as the new on attached to the network. Due to this unexpected delay we have had to make another slight adjustment to our estimated time frame and we're now aiming to have the power back on between 11:00 and 12:00.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on. Sent at 09:52 by Will.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry if you're still having problems with your power this morning, our engineers have advised that whilst they continue to try to locate the issue on our overhead network, they will be using temporary generators to provide power.

We have these on site now and are sending specialist engineers to connect them for us. At this stage we're estimating to have the power back on between 10:00 and 11:00. I'll continue to keep you updated with their progress but in the mean time, if you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us free on 105. Sent by Will at 08:27.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 15:01 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground network in the Burry Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Will, Aaron, Luke and Roland are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.

Sent by Kevin at 11:57 - We can now confirm that all power in the Levetts Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected issue with a generator being used to provide power, which our engineers resolved.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Levetts Lane area, the estimated time of between 14:00 and 15:00 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress. Sent by Kevin at 10:20.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 09:05 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is with the generator being used to supply power while repairs to our network take place in the Levetts Lane area.

Until an engineer arrives on site, it's difficult to give a time of restoration. Using an average timescale for this type of power cut in your area, we're looking to have the power back on between 14:00 and 15:00. 

We'll let you know once our staff arrive on site, and we'll keep you updated with all of our progress.

Sent by David at 10:56 - Hi David here again. We can now confirm that all power in the Bell Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 10:13 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 10:45 - Our engineers have restored power to all 654 properties in the Tollgate Road area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around a faulted piece of underground network equipment.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 10:09 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is faulty underground electrical equipment that initially interrupted power to 654 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 95 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 12:30-13:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 11:41 - We can now confirm that all power in the Lilford Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Lilford Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 14:00 and 15:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Simon at 11:14.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 14:00 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 4267 customers in the Herne Bay CT6 7 area, by diverting power around an underground network fault.  This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Herne Bay CT6 7 area to investigate the power cut affecting 50 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Kevin at 13:45.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Aaron at 15:09 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Connaught Street area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 18:30 and 19:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 02-FEB-2026 19:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 12:21. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
